fields.headline: Out of rhyme
fields.bodyText: Josh Robinson suggests that by abstaining in a European referendum we can register a refusal to accept that yes and no are the only options (Letters, June 17). Great idea if only three people take part. But who remembers the third of the electorate who didn't vote in the general election? Laurence Mann London Anthony Wilson's plans for east Lancashire may well "sprinkle some creative magic" over the area (Stacks of potential, Society, June 15). Sadly, such magic doesn't extend to his efforts at literary criticism. "Pennine" is not an iambus and in Wilson's rebranded name for the area, Pennine Lancashire, it is a trochee. Dr Nick Selby Department of English Literature, University of Glasgow Redundant Rover workers, and many European farmers, could learn a lesson from our immigrants. They are prepared to pitch in and do the jobs that no one else wants, becoming bus drivers and archbishops. John Riseley Farnborough, Hants A tax on airline fuel (Letters, June 16) might also encourage a much lower luggage allowance. At any major airport you will see people who have overburdened themselves with suitcases. But most people bring twice what they actually need. Cutting the allowance would make travellers realise that they can buy their shampoo at their destination. Suzon Forscey-Moore Cambridge Now we know the Magna Carta (Letters, June 18) wasn't signed but sealed, to whom was it delivered? Mike Broadbent Luton I assume that the Queen's MP3 player is called a wePod (Turning heads, June 17). Alan Paterson Cambridge
